clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Tang Ning Tongluo Formula in Type 2 Diabetics Clinical Analysis
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Tang Ning Tongluo Formula, a Traditional Chinese Miao Medicine, in Type 2 Diabetics: A Retrospective Clinical Analysis

lead_sponsor.agency: Guizhou Bailing Group Pharmaceutical Co Ltd

clinical_study.source: Guizhou Bailing Group Pharmaceutical Co Ltd

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this retrospective study is to review and describe safety and efficacy of Tang Ning Tong Luo capsule.

detailed_description.textblock: The aim of this retrospective study is to review and describe safety and efficacy of Tang Ning Tong Luo capsule,a traditional Chinese Miao medicine, in Type 2 Diabetics.

primary_outcome.measure: The Changing (%) of Blood Glucose Level and Glycosylated Hemoglobin Level from Baseline
primary_outcome.description: The Changing (%) of Blood Glucose Level (mmol/L) and Glycosylated Hemoglobin Level (%) from Baseline (start using Tang Ning Tong Luo capsule) in recruited Type 2 diabetes patients.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Number of Participants with Adverse Events Using Tangning Tongluo Capsule
secondary_outcome.description: The Number of Participants with Adverse Events Using Tangning Tongluo Capsule in the Treatment ofType II Diabetes

other_outcome.measure: Number of adverse events in recruited patients.
other_outcome.description: Number of adverse events in recruited patients.

clinical_study.condition: General Disorders and Administration Site Conditions

intervention.description: Taken drugs 3 times a day, with each time 3 grains

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
1. diagnosis of type 2 diabetes for more than one year.
2. the sustained follow-up time >3 month.
3. TNTL single or combined treatment time >3 month.
4. Chinese ethnicity.
Exclusion criteria:
1. the medical record information is not original and available.
2. lactating or pregnant.
3. diagnosis of heart failure, acute myocardial infarction, stroke, or serious injuries.
4. any other conditions not suitable for trial as evaluated by the physician in charge.
